titleStmt.title: By the King: a proclamation. James R. Whereas certain duties for excise and customs are made payable to us by several acts of Parliament out of all forreign goods and merchandizes that shall be imported into this our kingdom of Ireland; ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for alderman James Malone printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his shop in Skinnerrow. And by Andrew Crook on Ormond-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin-Castle the 4th day of April 1690."
Remitting excise and customs on imported foreign goods save tobacco and silk. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
